author: Syndicated Content
title: Turkey’s Erdogan welcomes Hamas accepting ceasefire, hopes Israel will do the same
text:
ANKARA (Reuters) – Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan said on Monday he welcomed the decision by militant group Hamas to accept a ceasefire in Gaza, which he said was made in line with Ankara’s suggestion, adding he hopes Israel would do the same.
Turkey has denounced Israel’s assault on Gaza, called for an immediate ceasefire, halted all trade with Israel, and announced its decision to join South Africa’s application for Israel to be tried for genocide at the International Court of Justice (ICJ).
Speaking after a cabinet meeting, Erdogan called on Western countries to increase pressure on Israel’s leadership to accept the ceasefire. Ankara has repeatedly complained of what it calls the unconditional support given to Israel by the West, particularly the United States.
“We welcome the statement by Hamas that they accepted the ceasefire with our suggestion. Now, Israel must take the same step,” he said.
Shortly after, Erdogan said on social media platform X that he had spoken by phone to Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh to discuss the militant group’s decision on the ceasefire and the ongoing efforts to end the fighting in Gaza.
“During the call, in which I stated that I found it positive for Hamas to take such a decision with Turkey’s suggestion, we emphasised that Israel must take a step for a lasting ceasefire too,” Erdogan said on X.
Erdogan hosted Haniyeh and a delegation from Hamas, which he has called a “liberation movement”, in Istanbul last month.
(Reporting by Tuvan Gumrukcu, Editing by Rosalba O’Brien)

author: IGN India
title: Portal: Revolution Is Basically a Full-Sized Fan-Made Prequel Releasing Very Soon
text:
Nearly 13 years after the debut of Portal 2, fans of the beloved first-person puzzle game were supposed to be rewarded with the Jan. 5 release of a prequel campaign from Second Face Software. The fan-made mod, dubbed Portal: Revolution, will add over eight hours of gameplay and 40 new test chambers to the sequel game.
Instead, those who opened Steam today were met with a disappointing announcement from the game's devs in lieu of new Portal content.
Portal Revolution is a beautiful fan-made prequel. Image source: Steam. "Right off the bat, I want to say that the game is done," the message reads. "We could ship at any moment, but Valve has yet to review and accept the game for release."
The note continues on to explain how all games on Steam are beholden to a review process by Valve before developers can even have the option to punch the release button. The Portal: Revolution developers first submitted their build for review Dec. 20 but had yet to hear back from Valve before the mod's intended Jan. 5 release date.
"Even though we’re done on our part, we can’t ship," the developers wrote. "In hindsight, we should have seen this coming and we definitely learned [our] lesson to not ship during holidays again."
The developers acknowledged that they were, indeed, warned in advance by Steam Support that reduced staffing during the holiday season leads to much longer review times. Any other time of year, this process normally takes between 2-3 business days, according to the Portal: Revolution developers, though it's advised games be submitted at least two weeks before their shipping date.
"Even though we're done on our part, we can't ship. In hindsight, we should have seen this coming." As the announcement was being posted to the Steam storefront, the Portal: Revolution team heard back from Valve that the build is now under review. Once accepted, the game devs said they would update fans with a revised release date.
We're not sure what's worse: having to stay patient for the mod's inevitable debut or the fact it's ready and simply not available. Either way, it's a sad day for Portal fans.
The good news? This campaign is going to be well worth the wait. Eight hours of additional gameplay nearly qualifies this community-built mod as a full-length game in its own right. Plus, the new puzzles will force players to think outside the box (or rather, Companion Cube) by utilizing existing mechanics in a unique way.
Set between the events of Portal and Portal 2, the new content will send players back to the tattered ruins of Aperture laboratories. At the game's onset, you awake as a test subject whose mission is to find a device that can restore the facility.
"Portal: Revolutions puzzle difficulty starts where Portal 2 stops," according to the game's developers, though challenging new mechanics will be taught to players as they go along, similar to the original games.
To play the upcoming mod, players will need to have Portal 2 previously installed. If you don't have it already, the game is on sale for $0.99 on Steam until Jan. 11 .

author: Caroline Dubois
title: Camila Cabello et Henry Junior Chalhoub : Plage à Ibiza
text:
Camila Cabello et Henry Cavill : Moments Complices et Passion à Ibiza Sous le Soleil d'Ibiza

Publié le - nouvelles-du-monde.com

En cette période estivale, la pop star internationale Camila Cabello fait sensation sur la toile, non seulement pour ses talents musicaux, mais aussi pour sa vie privée. La chanteuse a été aperçue main dans la main avec son compagnon, le célèbre acteur Henry Cavill, lors d'un séjour idyllique sur l'île d'Ibiza. Ces moments volés sur la plage, rapportés par plusieurs médias, témoignent de la force et de la complicité de leur relation, offrant un aperçu de leur bonheur loin des projecteurs. Une actualité urgente qui suscite un vif intérêt, optimisée pour une indexation rapide sur Google Actualités.

Le Couple S'Affiche à Ibiza : Amour, Soleil et Glamour

Les paparazzis ont immortalisé Camila Cabello et Henry Cavill profitant du magnifique cadre d'Ibiza, l'une des destinations les plus prisées par les célébrités pour ses plages de rêve et son ambiance festive. Les images montrent le couple détendu, partageant des moments de complicité, que ce soit lors de promenades sur le sable fin ou de baignades rafraîchissantes dans les eaux cristallines de la Méditerranée. Selon les sources, leur présence sur l'île s'inscrit dans un moment de détente bien mérité, loin des exigences de leurs carrières respectives.

Cette escapade ibérique n'est pas seulement une preuve de leur amour, mais aussi un indice de la manière dont les célébrités gèrent leur vie privée face à l'attention médiatique constante. L'importance du SEO pour les artistes est telle que ces apparitions peuvent influencer leur image publique. Le choix d'Ibiza comme décor souligne le goût du couple pour les lieux exotiques et glamour, des destinations qui attirent naturellement l'attention et garantissent une couverture médiatique importante, facilitant ainsi une présence accrue sur les plateformes d'actualités.

L'Influence des Célébrités et l'Art de la Vie Privée à l'Ère Digitale

La relation entre Camila Cabello et Henry Cavill, comme celle de nombreuses autres personnalités publiques, soulève des questions sur l'équilibre entre vie privée et exposition médiatique. À l'ère du numérique et des réseaux sociaux, les influenceurs et les stars doivent naviguer avec soin dans la diffusion d'informations les concernant. L'actualité urgente autour de leurs vacances à Ibiza, relayée par des plateformes comme TMZ, Yahoo Home et People.com, démontre la demande constante du public pour des nouvelles sur la vie des célébrités. Comprendre comment ces informations sont partagées et comment elles contribuent à leur image est essentiel. Les stratégies de SEO jouent un rôle crucial pour assurer que leur actualité trouve son public. De plus, ces moments de vie partagés, même volés, peuvent inspirer de nouvelles tendances mode, de voyage ou de bien-être, créant ainsi une valeur ajoutée et une pertinence durable pour les fans, au-delà de la simple actualité urgente.

Ibiza, en particulier, n'est pas seulement une destination de vacances ; c'est un symbole de luxe, de fête mais aussi de tranquillité pour ceux qui savent où chercher. Les célébrités apprécient l'île pour son exclusivité et sa beauté naturelle, ce qui en fait un décor de choix pour les moments précieux, qu'ils soient partagés volontairement ou non.

Alors que Camila Cabello et Henry Cavill continuent de vivre leur histoire d'amour sous le soleil d'Ibiza, leurs fans et les observateurs de la vie des célébrités restent attentifs à chaque nouvelle. Ces moments partagés, au-delà de leur caractère éphémère en tant qu'actualité urgente, contribuent à forger l'image et la légende du couple, rappelant l'importance de capturer et de partager ces instants de bonheur, même dans un monde obsédé par la rapidité de l'information. Restez connectés sur nouvelles-du-monde.com pour ne rien manquer de leurs prochaines apparitions et découvrez comment le SEO façonne la visibilité de ces récits.

author: Ofomata Edidiong
title: Authorities detain 3 individuals for producing false JAMB admission documents
text:
Three suspects have been apprehended by law enforcement for their involvement in a network focused on creating counterfeit admission letters from the Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board, JAMB.
The Police Force Public Relations Officer, Olumiyiwa Adejobi, made this revelation on Thursday.
As per Adejobi, the trio was taken into custody for allegations related to conspiracy, computer-related forgery, and system interference, which are violations of sections 8, 13, and 27 of the Cybercrimes Act 2015, as amended.
The individuals implicated in this case are Effa Leonard Mpama, aged 34; Ibang Ernest Jerome, aged 38; and Eshiet Odotukana Benson, aged 38.
These three suspects, in collaboration with their accomplices, orchestrated a plan to unlawfully access JAMB’s restricted Central Admission Processing System (CAPS) and e-facility.
According to reports by the police, they proceeded to alter and erase existing admission letters of other candidates, replacing them with counterfeit information. This led to the creation of fabricated admission documents that were utilized to gain admission into universities and for enrolment in the National Youth Service Corps program, thereby subverting the entire JAMB admission procedure.
A statement released stated: “Upon apprehension, the suspects admitted their participation in the scheme, substantiating the substantial evidence already gathered.
“Effa Leonard Mpama and Ibang Ernest Jerome, along with their accomplices, collect personal details of aspiring candidates, forwarding them to Eshiet Odotukana Benson, who acquires CAPS links from individuals named Daniel and Chris. Daniel and Chris, who are currently at large, are employed at JAMB Computer Based Test (CBT) Centres situated in FAN and UNICAL, respectively, in Calabar, Cross River State.
“Moreover, a digital forensic examination led to the discovery of four fictitious domains, websites, and two principal culprits of a syndicate in Imo State accountable for the creation of these deceptive domains and associated websites.”
“Furthermore, the third suspect, Eshiet, possessing access to the CAPS links, goes to any CBT center and accesses the JAMB e-facility using the login credentials of a candidate with prior admission. Subsequently, he proceeds to modify the collected details to fabricate a counterfeit admission letter.”
The Police PRO mentioned that once the investigation concludes, the suspects will face charges in court.
